text: Fun, fun, fun...and more to come...let's gooooo

Mike Conley said that Rudy Gobert already sent a text message in the Wolves group chat apologizing for the incident today. Kyle Anderson said it's something he and Rudy could move forward from. "We'll speak about it and move on. We're grown men."
Playoff brackets are set. Let’s gooooo…

Play-in games happen this week but the NBA has already announced the schedule for Saturday, the first official day of the playoffs: Nets-Sixers at 1pm ET 7th seed-Boston at 3:30pm ET Knicks-Cavs at 6pm ET Warriors-Kings at 8:30pm ET

Statement from ‘Wolves President of Basketball Operations Tim Connelly on Rudy Gobert: “We made the decision to send Rudy Gobert home after the incident in the second quarter. His behavior on the bench was unacceptable and we will continue handling the situation internally.”
Jaden McDaniels has suffered a broken right hand after punching a wall, per @ShamsCharania
Odell Beckham Jr has agreed to a deal with the #Ravens.
This section of the Western Conference standings is so bonkers right now. All these teams have either 7 or 8 games remaining.
More surprising news: LeBron will play for the first time in months, or that LeBron will come off the bench for the second time ever?

Phoenix Suns' 13-time All-Star Kevin Durant (sprained ankle) is progressing toward a potential return to action on Wednesday vs. Minnesota Timberwolves, barring any setback, league sources tell @TheAthletic @Stadium .
Monty Williams was extremely frustrated with the free throw disparity. He answered one question and then walked off.

With Ja Morant back on the floor tonight, @Matt_Barnes22 and I discuss what to expect from the young superstar and how the Grizzlies are taking precautions on the road to avoid putting Ja in tempting situations:

What do you expect from Ja Morant in his return tonight? @Matt_Barnes22 says Ja is about to go on a tear - we also talk the Wild West, whether the league is sleeping on the Cavs, and how Magic Johnson might shake up the NFL in the latest What's Burnin pod:
Paul George just left the arena on the back of a cart with his right leg extended. He nodded on his way out. Clippers not expecting to have an update on George tonight.
Always fun to work with the mogul @BaronDavis
Expecting some serious scoring on both sides in Sacramento tonight @DKSportsbook
Memphis Grizzlies guard Dillon Brooks has been suspended for Wednesday’s game vs. Houston after picking up his 18th technical foul of the season.
"I don't have an alcohol problem" - Ja Morant

Oh man - Willis Reed has died. 2x NBA champ, 2x Finals MVP, regular-season MVP, Hall of Famer and an absolute legend in New York, back when it was the most legendary place in the basketball universe. He will be so missed. #RIP
So much free basketball in Philly.

Are we getting closer to seeing a 'games minimum' requirement for the NBA's major awards, like MVP or DPOY? Should we be? @BoogieCousins says yes, I say no. But we both agree, if you think this is gonna fix load management, you're gonna be disappointed...

It sure sounds like the Packers would prefer to move on from Aaron Rodgers and begin the Jordan Love era immediately -- at least that's the sense after listening to team president Mark Murphy today. Story here:

Phoenix Suns star Kevin Durant is expected to be re-evaluated in two weeks with his left ankle sprain and return based on rehab progress, sources tell @TheAthletic @Stadium . Swelling has gone down in the ankle, which Durant injured slipping in pregame warmups Wednesday.
The Lakers say Mo Bamba has been diagnosed with a high left ankle sprain and will be reevaluated in four weeks.
Fred is one of my favorite players. I hate that he's going to get fined his entire 2022-23 salary...

The Knicks have won 9 of 10 - are they better set for the playoffs than last time? Will Chris Paul rise to the way opponents are defending the new-look Suns? And how much does defense count to award voters? New pod out with @Matt_Barnes22 & @DaTrillStak5 :

Just in: Glendale, Colorado police has closed its investigation into Grizzlies star Ja Morant with no charge or crime: “There was not enough available evidence to charge anyone with a crime.” Full release:

Every athlete we see playing professional sports has all kinds of things going on behind the scenes that we don’t know about - really impressed with the way @CalvinRidley1 opened up to tell us his in this @PlayersTribune piece. A lot of real talk here:
Anthony Davis is the first Laker with multiple 30+ point, 20+ rebound games in a single season since: Shaquille O'Neal (2003-2004)

After AD dropped 39 and 38 in the Lakers’ last two games, it seems like a good night to bet he’ll go big again @DKSportsbook #DKPartner #NBAPartner

Police in Colorado said Monday they were investigating Ja Morant's actions after the Memphis Grizzlies star posted an Instagram Live video in which he displayed what appeared to be a gun while at a nightclub. Reporting w/ ⁦⁦ @MerrillLiz ⁩
Jokic says he wasn’t surprised to be drafted last among the starters: “I would not draft myself either. I’m not meant for this game.”
Jokic on how the draft ended: “I thought I was last so I just stood up.” Said he feels bad, “I didn’t see Lauri.”

LeBron on Mac McClung: "He solidified himself as one of the greatest slam dunk competitors we've had in the history of the game." Said McClung belonged in the slam dunk company of MJ, Vince Carter and Aaron Gordon, among others.

LeBron said he huirt his hand after promising Coach Michael Malone one defensive play tonight: "I tried to get one little chasedown block and got my finger caught in the rim." Says sitting out the rest of the game was largely precautionary.
Yes @coach_collins doing fab job with this year’s @NUMensBball as they just beat high scoring @IowaHoops 80-60 . The Wildcats won their 20t & their stock is going uptown.
Heading to the big
You heard the man @ChaseAudige @NUMensBball
LeBron getting LOUD approval from the crowd here for drafting Kyrie

Giannis a little confused by the new draft format and tries to draft Ja early (in fairness, it’s reasonable to assume that - oh I don’t know - the best players would be available at the beginning of the draft. But I guess that’s crazy talk)
LeBron on the remaining schedule for the Lakers with the playoffs approaching: “23 of the most important games of my career - regular season.” (via @Rachel__Nichols )

"I was told LeBron was severely struggling with that foot injury he has [Tuesday night vs. the Thunder]... It gets to points where it just gets unbearable and he plays through it... The way it's explained to me is that might be something that lingers all season long, but it…
ALLEN IVERSON
As usual, lots of great details from @ramonashelburne & @WindhorstESPN here.

I asked Giannis if he’d been surprised to wake up & see KD had been traded, the final step in dismantling a superteam that at one point was his biggest threat in the East. The short answer? No. “From my experience you kinda saw it coming, that they would break up & go their ways”
John Wall has been notified by the Houston Rockets that he will be waived, positioning him to be among the top mid-season free agents, league sources tell @NBAonTNT , @BleacherReport .
"Reggie Jackson...Look for him and the Suns to make some contact in their near future." @ChrisBHaynes gives the latest on the buyout market
Lakers are planning a big pregame ceremony tonight for LeBron, complete with Kareem back in the building...but after that LeBron (ankle) will sit out the game against Giannis and the Bucks.

What a wild day - I was with an NBA owner today as their team was making a trade, and the phone never stopped ringing. This is gonna be so much fun watching how all these newly scrambled squads pan out.
Wait, the trade deadline is over? Brooklyn is just keeping 9 wings? What the hell?
Hide ya money y’all!!

Annnd it’s over. After all the dealing, @DKSportsbook has the Celtics as still the favorites to win the title this year at +350, but the Suns leapt up to the No. 2 spot, going from +1800 to +425 post Durant trade.
This all because @JaMorant said he was good in the West
Pretty amazing on @mikal_bridges ’ Twitter feed right now - look at the pinned tweet, with his reaction to the trade right under it:

Kyrie on Kevin Durant getting traded from Brooklyn to Phoenix: “I’m just glad he got out of there.” Kyrie also noted that “there’s never been one moment where I felt he’s been angry at me for the decisions I’ve made.” : @MarkG_Medina
Just spent a few minutes talking with Kareem Abdul-Jabbar. Could not have been more gracious about LeBron breaking his record – and says he’s ready to come back Thursday if need be.
NBA Commissioner Adam Silver just got to his seat here at the arena - in time to see LeBron drill that three.
Man it is ELECTRIC in here already.

So does LeBron break the record tonight? Matt Barnes & I have a difference of opinion - but c'mon, wouldn't you rather see him do it in a game where he drops nearly 40...or have all this anticipation, wait two days, then score like 8 pts in the first quarter Thursday and...yay?

Latest episode of the What’s Burnin pod - Stephen Jackson and Matt Barnes have advice for Ja Morant, as two guys who’ve been there, plus how Kyrie will fit with Luka and how late is too late for the Warriors:
Phoenix Suns new owner Mat Ishbia intends to bring on Hall of Famer Isiah Thomas to have a prominent role in the front office, league sources tell @NBAonTNT , @BleacherReport .
Was not sure this was gonna happen. Credit to Kareem for coming, despite any differences he and LeBron have had in the past.

Jason Kidd says Dallas is “Luka’s team” but is full of praise for Kyrie. “I couldn’t do the things that he can do. His finishing is unbelievable….and just his dribbling skills, I could only go straight, he can go left, right and backward.”
Kyrie Irving’s first practice with the Mavericks:

Kyrie Irving in his first press conference since the trade says he felt “disrespected” by the Nets and wishes that he had paid more attention going in to who were the people running the franchise. Said he felt “wanted” by the Mavericks.
KD declined to comment on his way out of Barclays.

Among the possibilities for expanding the Kyrie Irving-to-Dallas trade before this evening's scheduled trade call: League sources say that Brooklyn has explored the feasibility of packaging Spencer Dinwiddie and draft capital to Toronto in an attempt to acquire Fred VanVleet.

LeBron James to @RealMikeWilbon on the Lakers not getting Kyrie: "Definitely disappointed. I can't sit here and say I'm not disappointed on not being able to land someone…I got great chemistry on the floor with, that can help you win championships.”

Anyone who says they can predict how it will work out with Kyrie in Dallas…hasn’t been paying attention the past couple years. But it’s sure gonna be a lot of fun to watch, and I love Dallas being aggressive to try to help Luka now.
Idolized this man in my childhood. #RIP

The Kings are five games above .500 for the first time since April 2006. @ESPNStatsInfo . Sacramento went over 16 years between instances of being 5 games above .500, by far the longest span in NBA history per the Elias Sports Bureau.

In midst of turbulent season, Atlanta Hawks head coach Nate McMillan has strongly considered resigning from his position, sources say. Details on McMillan remaining as coach for now and his tenuous status in Atlanta at @TheAthletic :

Phoenix is 2-5 (2-6 if you include the Denver game) in the games Devin Booker has missed. 20-15 overall (including a terrific win last night vs. Memphis).” 3 games out of first 1.5 out of the top 6 3.5 out of the top 10 8 out of the next 10 on the road
INJURY UPDATE: Further evaluation has confirmed that Devin Booker has sustained a left groin strain. He will be re-evaluated in four weeks.

Raiders are benching Derek Carr and turning to Jarrett Stidham as their new starting QB. Carr has thrown a league-leading 14 interceptions— including three Saturday night during a 13-10 loss to the Steelers. Stidham has thrown only 61 passes and never has started an NFL game.
60 points on 31 shots seems pretty good.
NBA teams were 0-13,884 in the last 20 seasons when trailing by at least nine with 35 or fewer seconds remaining, per @ESPNStatsInfo . Luka Doncic and the Mavs pulled off a miracle.

Sources: Broncos players were just informed that senior assistant coach Jerry Rosburg, whom Nathaniel Hackett hired during the season to aid him in clock management strategy, is now taking over as the Broncos’ interim head coach, effective immediately.

Saturday was surreal for John Wall, coming back to D.C. in front of fans for the first time since the Wizards traded him. On a day that started w/talk about getting his jersey retired, & ended with him screaming, "this is still my city!' In @TheAthletic :
"Just the love I got. This is something I've been waiting for for 4 years." John Wall on his return to DC

I wrote about my friend Grant Wahl. https://cbc.ca/sports/soccer/worldcup/world-cup-grant-wahl-chris-jones-dec10-1.6681667…
HISTORY FOR MOROCCO. FIRST AFRICAN TEAM TO MAKE THE WORLD CUP SEMIFINALS! @EnMaroc #AtlasLions #DimaMaghrib #MAR @FIFAcom @FIFAWorldCup #FIFAWorldCup : @LolGriffiths , Francois Nel, @AlexGrimmGetty
You had a huge impact on me and my family and I’m so appreciative of you. A great person and journalist. Rest In Paradise Grant Wahl.

LeBron James on Grant Wahl: "Very fond of Grant, and having that cover shoot, me being a teenager and him covering that, was a pretty cool thing. ... I've always kind of watched from a distance. ... It's a tragic loss. It's unfortunate to lose someone as great as he was."
This is awful. Grant was a phenomenal, brilliant journalist; my heart goes out to his family.

Grant Wahl’s brother Eric believes the Qatari government may have been involved in Grant’s death: “My brother was healthy. He told me he received death threats. I do not believe my brother just died. I believe he was killed. And I just beg for any help.”
More on Grant Wahl’s death from @NPR , including that Grant hadn’t been feeling well today. https://npr.org/2022/12/09/1142054844/grant-wahl-soccer-writer-dies-qatar-world-cup…
Wow. What. A. Day. Can’t ask for better set of games than that.
MGM Grand out $100,000 over the last two games.

Now *that* was a sequence in LA. Sharpe with a building-rattling dunk for Portland matched by a Russell Westbrook three-point buzzer beater on the other end.
Turned out to be his final stat line. Wow.

NBA informed teams today that the 2023-24 season will start on Oct. 24, 2023, and conclude April 14, 2024. Noteworthy: If/when In-Season Tournament is approved, initial schedule will have 80 games per team; remaining games scheduled after eight teams advance to knockout rounds.

Sources: Two notable injury updates: - Bucks star Khris Middleton is nearing his season debut, potentially as soon as Friday vs. Lakers. - 76ers star James Harden is targeting return on current three-game road trip, likely in Houston on Monday.

The Dallas Mavericks have signed Kemba Walker. The 11-year veteran averaged 20+ points in five straight seasons from 2015-16 to 2019-20, earning four consecutive All-Star nods from 2017 to 2020. Walker will wear #34 for Dallas.

This is how insane Embiid’s night is. He is the first player with 55 points and 5 blocks since blocks were tracked in 1973. The thing is he had 59 points, 7 blocks PLUS 11 rebounds and 8 assists. Just absolutely insane.

The league’s investigation found no wrongdoing in James Harden’s near $15 million pay cut last summer – but findings showed that the 76ers made early free agency discussions with Danuel House Jr. and PJ Tucker, NBA says.

The Lakers are shooting 21.2% on 3-pointers this season. In NBA history, there have been over 6,100 instances of a team taking at least 100 3-pointers over a 3-game span. The Lakers 21.1% is the 2nd-worst among that group, trailing only the Hawks in 2018 (21.0%). @ESPNStatsInfo

Warriors Coach Steve Kerr says Draymond Green will has been fined but not suspended and will return to the team Thursday. Green will play in Golden State’s final preseason game and then in the season opener next Tuesday.

Re: LaMelo Ball: A grade 2 sprain is also known as a partial tear. Other players to sustain G2 ankle sprains includes Mike Conley, Ja Morant, and Trae Young. The average time lost is ~7 games (~19 days) with the time lost virtually the same when just guards are examined.

Buckle up for our FIVE HOUR Jump Free Agency Special starting at the top of the hour with Woj, Matt Barnes, Stephen A Smith, Perk, Chris Bosh, Marc Spears, Zach Lowe, Ramona Shelburne, Malika Andrews, Dave McMenamin, Brian Windhorst, Bobby Marks, Nick Friedell & Jackie Mac.

The Warriors spent this week trying to trade their picks - but ended up having to make them. How did they do? Marc Spears manages to change Perk's mind on this one, plus says don't count out the possibility of Ben Simmons in Golden State.

Monty Williams is "hopeful" Cam Payne (ankle) can play for the Suns in Game 4. Monty said he was walking behind Cam from the hotel to the arena for practice, and he was relieved to see Payne walking totally normally. Payne did light work at practice today, as did the whole team.

We're watching a changing of the guard in the NBA - half of the top scorers in the playoffs are under 25 years old. And I'm not sure if Trae Young has one of those tall fuzzy hats, but he certainly could pull it off; he's accomplished pretty much anything he wants to lately.
Catching up with Paul George after the Clippers edged their way back into this series - on his team’s resiliency, his friendship with Reggie Jackson, and the biggest fighter he knows: his mom.

Devin Booker elaborated on @Rachel__Nichols ' report about his nose being broken in three places and needing to get it set back into place. He said normally a patient is put under for the procedure, but there was no time for that. He got 8 shots of numbing agent and it was go time

I asked Chris Paul to describe what his last week or so was like: “Shit happens and it did, and I’m here now.” He added that he did get some shots up on his home court while he was in the protocols, but that otherwise he was away from the game the whole time.

paul george is doing to ayton what kd did to brook the difference is monty immediately has ayton play the level of the screen paul george is now using that to find open teammates love this type of chess

LA hitting three's to take back the lead in this game. Monty Williams told me at halftime that one of his primary messages to his Suns players was that they have to do a better job running the Clippers off the arc.
Annnnnnd now he's on the sideline stretching that leg out.

Markieff Morris courtside tonight - at one point in the first half he was yelling at his brother to close out on Devin Booker harder. The twins of course played here in PHX earlier in their careers; let’s just say it did not end well, but all sides have moved on to better times.

Marcus Morris not starting this second half. Ty Lue told me he's in the back getting his knee worked on after experiencing some pain in the first half; possible he may get an injection in an attempt to get back onto the floor.

Chris Paul may not be in the building today, but his brother CJ & his dad are still courtside showing their support, with still more family members in the stands. CP's family has been welcomed by this Suns team since Chris was traded here; been a really cool extended relationship

DeMarcus Cousins being in the game is part of what we reported pregame, that Ty Lue is going deep on his rotations today, particularly in his first half, as he tries to keep his starters' minutes down after such a heavy effort just 36 hours ago in Game 6 vs the Jazz

Huge congrats to James Jones, who has done such a great job here in Phoenix and earned every bit of that Executive of the Year award. They call the man "Champ" for a reason - he and Monty have drastically changed the Suns' culture and it's landed them in the Conference Finals.

Suns Coach Monty Williams refers to the chippiness between these teams during the regular season and says he's reminded players not to get distracted today: "We want to win the game, not the argument"
